title: Milton Keynes Irish F.C.
text:
Milton Keynes Irish Football Club is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Fenny%20Stratford">Fenny Stratford</a>, a constituent town of <a href="Milton%20Keynes">Milton Keynes</a>, <a href="Buckinghamshire">Buckinghamshire</a>, England. They are currently members of the and play at Manor Fields.
History.
Buckingham Town/Milton Keynes Robins.
The club was established as Buckingham Town in 1883, playing their first match against <a href="Banbury%20United%20F.C.">Banbury United</a>. They won the Aylesbury & District League in 1902–03 and 1936–37 and the <a href="North%20Bucks%20%26amp%3B%20District%20Football%20League">North Bucks League</a> in 1924–25, 1928–29, 1933–34, 1935–36, 1936–37, 1938–39, 1948–49 and 1949–50. They were founder members of the <a href="Hellenic%20Football%20League">Hellenic League</a> in 1953, but left after only four seasons. They won the Aylesbury & District League again in 1967–68.
Buckingham Town joined Division One of the <a href="South%20Midlands%20League">South Midlands League</a> in 1971, where they played until joining Division Two of the United Counties League in 1974. Their first season in the league saw them finish second, earning promotion to Division One. After finishing as Division One runners-up in 1975–76, the club secured a second successive promotion, moving up to the Premier Division. They were Premier Division champions and Knockout Cup winners in 1983–84, and the <a href="1984%E2%80%9385%20FA%20Cup">following season</a> they reached the first round of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> for the first (and to date only) time in their history, losing 2–0 at home to <a href="Leyton%20Orient%20F.C.">Orient</a>.
In 1985–86 Buckingham Town won the Premier Division again and were promoted to the Midland Division of the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern League</a>. After being transferred to the Southern Division in 1988, they won the division in <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20Southern%20Football%20League">1990–91</a>, but were not promoted as their ground failed to meet the standards required. They were moved back to the Midland Division in 1994, but returned to the Southern Division in 1996. However, after finishing bottom of the division in <a href="1996%E2%80%9397%20Southern%20Football%20League">1996–97</a>, they were relegated back to the Premier Division of the United Counties League. The 2006–07 season saw them finish bottom of the Premier Division, resulting in relegation to Division One. The club announced that they were folding at the end of the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20United%20Counties%20League">2017–18 season</a>. However, the decision was later reversed.
The club was renamed Milton Keynes Robins in January 2019.
Unite MK.
<a href="Unite%20MK%20F.C.">Wolverton Town F.C.</a> was founded in 2004, joining the Milton Keynes Sunday League. In 2005, the club joined the <a href="North%20Bucks%20%26amp%3B%20District%20Football%20League">North Bucks & District League</a>. In <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20in%20English%20football">2012–13</a>, the club joined the <a href="Spartan%20South%20Midlands%20Football%20League">Spartan South Midlands League</a> Division Two. In July 2016, the club renamed to Unite MK. Unite MK entered the <a href="FA%20Vase">FA Vase</a> for the first time in <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20FA%20Vase">2018–19</a>.
Milton Keynes Irish.
In May 2020, Milton Keynes Robins, Unite MK and Milton Keynes Irish Veterans merged to form Milton Keynes Irish F.C. In 2021 the club were promoted to the Premier Division based on their results in the abandoned <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Spartan%20South%20Midlands%20Football%20League">2019–20</a> and <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Spartan%20South%20Midlands%20Football%20League">2020–21</a> seasons.
Ground.
Buckingham Town played at Ford Meadow from 1883 until being evicted at the end of the 2010–11 season. They then played at the Winslow Centre in <a href="Winslow%2C%20Buckinghamshire">Winslow</a> for the 2011–12 season, before moving to Manor Fields in the Fenny Stratford area of Milton Keynes.
Wolverton Town played at The New Park in <a href="Wolverton%20and%20Greenleys">Greenleys</a> until they moved to Manor Fields in 2016.
Honours.
Buckingham Town

Unite MK
